entry.title: Cataloging of the PHI online Latin texts
entry.content:
Posted on behalf of Blake Landor:
This is to announce that the cataloging of the PHI online Latin texts project, which I announced last October (below), is finally finished. A  link to the file of MARC records for the PHI Latin texts database is at the bottom of our cataloging Creative Commons CC0 web page.  Institutions are now free to download these records to their online catalogs.  If you want to preview these records, go to UF’s catalog and type “Packard Humanities Institute” in the “anywhere” field.

Many thanks to Chuck Jones for suggesting this idea and to Chuck and Karen Green for writing supporting letters for the mini grant.  Let me know if you have questions.

Blake Landor
Classics, Philosophy, Religion and General Humanities Librarian
George A. Smathers Libraries
University of Florida
Gainesville, Fl 32611-117001
tele 352-273-2644

The records are public domain with unrestricted downstream use for any purpose. The University of Florida Smathers Libraries welcomes and encourages their re-use. If you wish to have these in your own library catalog you are welcome to upload them.  Please bring this notice to the attention of your librarians.

n.b.:  The Classical Latin Texts Database Records will be permanently available in the George A. Smathers Libraries section of the Institutional Repository at the University of Florida.

link.title: Cataloging of the PHI online Latin texts
